author: Special Correspondent
text:
The State Transport Department has been according top priority to ensure that the buses, particularly the omni buses, strictly followed the safety norms to the core.

The officials of the transport department have been conducting regular surprise checks particularly during the festival seasons not only to check the exploitation of the innocent people by the omni buses, but also to ensure that they strictly adopted all the established norms.

The state transport department conducted surprise check of the omni buses to find out whether they have remitted the required tax, possessed fitness certificates, commissioned the speed-regulators etc.

Special teams of officials from the offices of the Regional Transport Officers in Salem and Dharmapuri districts conducted surprise check of the omni buses in connection with the Christmas festival season. A total of 1,056 buses were checked by the officials at the toll plazas, bus stops etc during the month of December.

The officials booked 285 omni buses for violations such as over-loading, operating them without fitness certificates etc.

A fine of Rs. 5.31 lakhs was collected from the erring omni buses.

Moreover, four omni buses which were plying without fitness certificates were also seized on the occasion, according to transport department sources.
title: Priority accorded to safety
